page.title: 01RUGGED BEAUTY OF NORTH HILL
page.content: North Hill, populated by some 500 people living in scattered hamlets and isolated farms, among landscape which ranges over grassland, woodland, wetland and moorland, has changed little over the years. Hill farming it its main industry. Many farms hav ebeen tenanted by the same families for generations. Most wage earners work out of the area and the children 'bus to school' elsewhere. Bus services are resticted, so car ownership is essential. A local repair garage is maintained and delivery services are regular. The village stores and post offices, along with thw church. chapel, inn and village hall, play an important part in the rural life. By supporting the many clubs and organisations, the social life is varied. Political life is governed by the Parish Council.
